origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. records 1920s-2005 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. The London Office first opened in 1926, and was JWT's first international office and the first international office of any American advertising agency. Consists primarily of account files, Knowledge Center subject files, books and publications, general office files, and the papers of some executives. Major clients represented include DeBeers; Elida Gibbs; Gallaher Tobacco; Guinness; Kellogg's; Kodak; Kraft; Nestlé; Rowntree; Scott Paper; SmithKline Beecham; Unilever; and Warner-Lambert. Includes photographs and slides; scrapbooks; videocassettes; scripts to commercials; and proof sheets of printed advertisements. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Unpublished materials are closed to non-JWT employees for 15 years from the date of creation.
Some materials may require additional processing before they can be made available to researchers.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gifts in 1987-2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in other collections of the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives:

scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of account files, Knowledge Center subject files, books and publications, general office files, and the papers of some executives. Major clients represented include DeBeers; Elida Gibbs; Gallaher Tobacco; Guinness; Kellogg's; Kodak; Kraft; Nestlé; Rowntree; Scott Paper; SmithKline Beecham; Unilever; and Warner-Lambert. Includes photographs and slides; scrapbooks; videocassettes; scripts to commercials; and proof sheets of printed advertisements.
NOTE: Scott, Bowater Scott, Andrex and Kimberly Clark are related companies. Lever, Unilever and Elida Gibbs are related companies. Rowntree and Nestlé are related companies.

scopecontent.p: Contains materials from the Knowledge Centre: Kellogg's commercials on 11 Umatic tapes; Lipton, Unilever, Rowntree/Nestlé, Rolex and Manfield & Sons account files; financial records; TTB, WPP Atticus and Year in Review publications; Unilever/Knorr Chicken Tonight radio spots on CD; Umatic Jim Foster on Brouillard; VHS tape of DeBeers 1992 and Women's Attitude toward Cooking in Europe 2000.

CDs and a document relating to Thompson Total Branding Awards, 1998-2001

[Illustrated publication which gives background on the JWT London Office then located at Bush House, Aldwych.]

scopecontent.p: [Assisted the public in coping with continued food rationing after World War II.]
[Part of the London Creative (?) Department. Attention: Contains pictorial materials.]

scopecontent.p: Original sketches and animation cells for commercials featuring Kellogg’s Tony the Tiger

did.unittitle: Proof books from JWT’s Berlin, Germany Office1928-1938

scopecontent.p: [Includes Kraft, 1928; Horlick’s, 1929 (2 books); Ponds, 1936-1938; Only known original proof books from this office; most print ads from that era outside the U.S. have survived only on microfilm that is in the JWT archives.]

Primarily tapes and transcripts of interviews done by Tom Rayfield with various JWT staff for Rayfield's book Fifty in 40: The Unofficial History of JWT London, 1945-1995. Also includes notes and a draft timeline. Tapes and master transcripts are closed to non-JWT researchers; see Use Copies of transcripts in boxes 1-2.
